text:
North (Hudson) River, showing (right to left) piers 83, 84 and 86, off Twelfth Ave., at the foot of West 43rd, 44th and 46th Streets. The S.S. Leviathan of the United States Lines is berthed at pier 86. Also shown (background) is the skyline of Midtown Manhattan.

About 1929.

Ewing Galloway.
title: North (Hudson) River - Piers 83-86.

text: Twelfth Avenue, west side, at West 43rd Street, showing street activity outside of the pier that formerly housed the Hamburg - American Steamship Line. The photographer states the line consists of relief recipients awaiting their dole for the work performed by them at Bear Mountain Palisade Park. This was a phase of the local experiment under the C.W.A. It was replaced with the direct government directed projects under the W.P.A. August 29, 1933. P. L. Sperr.

Twelfth Avenue, west side, at West 43rd Street, showing street activity outside of the pier that formerly housed the Hamburg - American Steamship Line. The photographer states the line consists of relief recipients awaiting their dole for the work performed by them at Bear Mountain Palisade Park. This was a phase of the local experiment under the C.W.A. It was replaced with the direct government directed projects under the W.P.A. August 29, 1933. P. L. Sperr.

43rd Street, east from near Twelfth Avenue.
March 20, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
